rss.channel:
广告牌 https://www.billboard.com音乐排行榜、新闻、照片和视频2023 年 10 月 10 日，星期二 20:14:24 +0000 en-US每小时1 https://wordpress.org/?v=6.2.2 LE SSERAFIM 反思“UNFORGIVEN”的成功及首次巡演：采访https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/le-sserafim-interview-unforgiven-first-tour-1235438986/ Tue, 10 Oct 2023 20:14:15 +0000 MusicMusic NewsBillboard JapanGlobalJapan https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235438986 Billboard Japan spoke to LE SSERAFIM about what's happened in the year since their debut, their well-received album and latest single, and their first solo tour.

LE SSERAFIM是 Billboard Japan 每月专题采访系列中的最新艺术家，该系列展示了吸引眼球的各种艺术家和作品。她们于 2022 年 5 月首次亮相，是 SOURCE MUSIC 和 HYBE（BTS 和无数其他全球艺术家背后的品牌）制作的首个女子组合。

今年1月，LE SSERAFIM发行了首张日本单曲《FEARLESS》，并举办了纪念展示活动。 5月，乐队发行了第一张录音室专辑《UNFORGIVEN》。该专辑在日本公告牌“热门专辑”总专辑榜、“最佳专辑销量”周专辑销量榜以及“下载专辑”榜上均位居第一。

有关的

LE SSERAFIM 即将与 Demi Lovato 推出合作作品：它即将到来

10/10/2023

专辑主打歌“UNFORGIVEN”的日语版本于八月作为他们的第二张日语单曲发行。 《UNFORGIVEN (feat. Nile Rodgers, Ado) - Japanese ver.-》收录了 Ado 的作品，日本独家曲目《Jewelry (Prod. imase)》由 im​​ase 制作，在日本引起了轰动。 Billboard Japan 采访了 LE SSERAFIM，谈论了他们出道一年来发生的事情、广受好评的专辑和最新单曲，以及他们的首次个人巡演。 （由于日程问题，HUH YUN JIN 未能与其他成员一起接受采访，稍后独自接受采访。）

距离你出道已经快一年了。您能否告诉我们，今年你们每个人认为自己在哪些方面实现了最大的个人成长？

KAZUHA：我最大的成长是韩语的进步。

金彩元，你呢？

KIM CHAEWON：出道前和出道后，我在舞台上表演时还没有处于享受自我的状态。不过现在，我已经能够轻松地在舞台上享受乐趣了。我认为这是我成长很多的一个领域。

您能否谈谈 LE SSERAFIM 的独特之处以及您的优势是什么？

SAKURA：我们的很多歌词都是基于我们的实际生活经历，所以我认为我们的歌曲可以给那些有类似经历的人带来鼓励和共鸣。我认为我们的优势在于我们歌颂我们如何生活的哲学。

你的现场表演怎么样？

KIM CHAEWON：当我们登上舞台时，我们会尝试与所有粉丝一起创造一场现场表演，作为集体努力。例如，我们放置呼叫和响应部分，以便观众可以响应。

五月，你发行了你的第一张录音室专辑《UNFORGIVEN》 。我听说你在日本录制了几首歌曲。在录制过程中您有什么感悟或发现吗？

SAKURA：这张专辑里有很多我不太熟悉的风格的歌曲，比如《Fire in the belly》，里面有很多拉丁风格的声音。所以当我们录音时，我发现了我不知道的新声音。有时这很难，但我认为通过《UNFORGIVEN》 ，听众将能够在整张专辑中享受各种类型的音乐。

为录制做了哪些准备？

KAZUHA：我们开始在日本录制《UNFORGIVEN (feat. Nile Rodgers)》，我的做法是以一种黑暗、酷的方式唱开场白“Unforgiven, I'm a vivil, I'm a”。但我得到了一些建议，尝试用更轻的音调来唱，当我尝试时，制作人也说，“就在那里，就是这样。”这部分让你印象深刻，制片人说他想让它成为一个令人上瘾的钩子，所以我很高兴我能够很好地完成这部分。我认为这张专辑的录制让我体验到了最好的录制过程，尽管我们受到时间限制。

KIM CHAEWON：我们没有那么多的时间来录音，所以我非常小心地确保我的声音处于最佳状态。

HONG EUNCHAE：我在《UNFORGIVEN (feat. Nile Rodgers)》中唱了一段较长的部分。这是我第一次这样做，我想做得很好，所以我练习展示自己最好的一面。

我觉得你的第一张录音室专辑《UNFORGIVEN》就是带着这种为自己铺平道路的愿望而制作的，不受其他人如何看待你或他们的想法的阻碍。这张专辑获得了众多歌迷的支持，并登上了热门排行榜的榜首。你认为这对你意味着什么？你对这张专辑的反响有何感受？

KIM CHAEWON：在准备录音的时候，我们的目标并不是冲进排行榜。我们只是想尽我们所能，通过音乐表达自己。这就是我们制作专辑时所关注的。我们认为人们会看到我们所取得的成就，随之而来的是认可。

SAKURA： 《UNFORGIVEN》在我们庆祝一周年纪念日的前一天发布，你可以看到我们这一年所付出的努力。很多人通过“ANTIFRAGILE”发现了我们，我认为人们对我们的期望对我们产生了很好的影响。真正的考验将是我们从这里走向何方。我希望我们继续创作只有我们才能做到的音乐。

HUH YUNJIN：我能感受到很多人对我们的歌曲和表演的喜爱，我很高兴我们试图分享的信息能够传达给人们。我希望我们成为一支能够对看到我们表现的人产生积极影响的团队，帮助他们勇敢地携手并进，不断前进。

你能谈谈你的第二张日本单曲“UNFORGIVEN”吗？单曲中的其中一首歌曲是由今濑制作的日本独家歌曲《Jewelry (Prod. imase)》，这首歌的亮点是什么？

KIM CHAEWON：歌词很美。 LE SSERAFIM 的很多歌曲都具有冷静、精致的氛围，但《Jewelry (Prod. imase)》是一首明亮、欢快的歌曲。

SAKURA：我认为它确实很悦耳，非常适合在深夜开车时聆听。 LE SSERAFIM的很多歌曲都是以说唱为主的歌曲，但是当我们录制这首歌时，我们试图让我们的声音真正发光。

KAZUHA：通常，在录音过程中，我会非常精确地分解事情，比如，“在这一部分，我会这样做，在这部分，我会这样做。”不过，在《Jewelry (Prod. imase)》中，我感受到了能量，并且唱得很开心。

洪恩彩：“闪闪发光”这个词在歌词中出现了几次，当我唱这首歌时，我想象着美丽、闪闪发光的场景，并在我唱歌时产生共鸣。

HUH YUNJIN：我喜欢城市流行音乐，音乐和歌词都很棒。

主打歌《UNFORGIVEN (feat. Nile Rodgers, Ado) -Japan ver.-》由日本歌手 Ado 演唱。当决定与她合作时，你有什么感受？

HONG EUNCHAE：我知道 Ado 是一位非常知名的艺术家，所以当我发现她要与我们合作一首歌曲时，我简直不敢相信。

KAZUHA：Ado 拥有真正独特的歌声，所以我很高兴听到她与我们合作时的声音。

HUH YUNJIN：这太出乎我的意料了，我简直不敢相信。我记得第一次听到 Ado 时，我就对她这位出色的艺术家印象深刻。我从没想过能够和她一起工作。

您于 8 月 12 日在首尔举行了首次个人巡演 2023 LE SSERAFIM TOUR 'FLAME RISES' 演出。在日本，您在名古屋、东京和大阪进行了演出。巡演名称中的“FLAME RISES”从何而来？

SAKURA：指的是我们烧毁身后走过的路，这样就没有回头路了，我们唯一的选择就是继续前进。也是因为我们想上演一场火热的表演。

反应如何？

KIM CHAEWON：在我们出道之前，我们就已经把目光投向了举办演唱会。我很高兴能够参加我们的第一次 LE SSERAFI 巡演。我什至很难相信这一点。我们一定要照顾好自己的健康，希望我们能让这次旅行取得圆满成功。

SAKURA：很多演唱会都会以一首安静、深情的歌曲结束，但我们会以一首非常激动人心的歌曲来结束我们的演唱会，让观众兴奋不已。就像我们的巡演名称“FLAME RISES”所唤起的形象一样，我们希望在舞台上燃烧起来。在我们的演出中，我们看到观众全身心地享受演出，所以这对我们来说也很兴奋。

HUH YUNJIN：真是太有趣了。我非常感谢人们在百忙之中抽出时间来看我们。我希望我们继续在演出中享受乐趣，保持健康并呈现令人印象深刻的表演。

最后您有什么想对我们的读者或您的粉丝说的吗？

KIM CHAEWON：我希望你能经常播放我们的第二张日本单曲《UNFORGIVEN》，如果你来观看我们的一场演出，我希望你能度过一生中最愉快的时光。

SAKURA：我很高兴能够亲身体验人们对我们音乐的喜爱。我们将在这次巡演的剩余时间里继续上演精彩的演出，然后为下一次巡演做好准备，取得进一步的发展，所以我们期待您的持续支持。

; VTuber Tokoyami Towa 剖析《Aster》首张专辑以及机构间合作如何发生：采访https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/vtuber-tokoyami-towa-interview-aster-album-1235438972/ Tue, 10 Oct 2023 20:13:07 +0000 MusicMusic NewsBillboard JapanGlobalJapan https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235438972 The Startend VTuber shared her thoughts on her 12-track debut set and its production process with Billboard Japan.

Tokoyami Towa 于 2020 年首次亮相，作为 Hololive 第四代虚拟 YouTuber 群体之一，目前其频道拥有超过 130 万订阅者。这位以游戏直播为主的 VTuber 还发布了自己翻唱和原创音乐的视频，展示了她标志性的强劲、沙哑的声音和宽广的音域。

Tokoyami——她的名字按照日语顺序排列，姓氏在前——最近推出了她的第一张专辑《 Aster》 ，这是一个备受期待的项目，通过一群独特的创作者创作的曲目展示了她作为歌手的潜力。这位 Startend VTuber 分享了她对她的 12 首曲目首张专辑及其制作过程的看法，包括如何与其他 VTuber 和主播进行罕见的合作。

有关的

Hololive English Talks 的 Takanashi Kiara 在首张专辑《Point…》中表达了她真实的自我

10/10/2023

是什么促使您成为一名 VTuber？

我加入hololive的原因是因为我想交朋友。我当时很喜欢看和玩第一人称射击游戏，虽然hololive是一群“偶像”，但我认为同时成为偶像和游戏玩家会很有趣。游戏直播的好处在于您可以观看玩家的进步。他们互相交流思想，互相努力竞争。我想通过我的活动传达出，努力并不是什么丢脸的事，到目前为止的努力积累比输赢更重要。

从某种意义上说，你的首张专辑《Aster》体现了你迄今为止职业生涯的积累。告诉我们它的概念。

我想用它来表达常暗东和是谁。这张专辑还有一个隐藏的主题，我鼓励大家猜测。我花了很长时间才做出决定。我回顾了一些事情，比如我当时的感受，我这些年所做的工作。

主打单曲《ANEMONE》由音乐制作人 Yuyoyuppe（间宫武宏）创作。为什么选择这首歌作为专辑的主打歌曲？

真的很难决定。我认为根本没有主打单曲也没关系，因为专辑中有很多不同类型的歌曲。但我觉得《ANEMONE》最能展现常暗十和与其他VTuber（包括hololive和其他地方）的优势，所以我选择了它。

您能详细说明一下“常暗东和的优势”是什么意思吗？

首先，我有很好的音域。当我唱高音时我可以保持声音稳定，这也是我的优势之一。像《ANEMONE》这样火爆的重金属歌曲在VTuber界并不常见，所以能够用铿锵有力的声音唱出这样的歌曲是常暗东和的标志性风格。

歌词中有哪些想法？

在我的职业生涯中，人们对我说过好话，也说过不太好话。有时我会沉迷于消极的事情，但最终我想决定我想做的事情并按照我自己的方式生活。当我把这些感受告诉 Yuyoyuppe 时，他说：“这真的很棒，让我们把它结合起来吧。”这就是我们在创作歌词时出现的“我想像我一样生活”这句话。

那么你平时的直播活动 和像这个项目这样的音乐项目相互影响密切吗？

就像是，“让我们用音乐来表达我通常无法表达的东西。”对于专辑中的歌曲“Taidana Wonder”，我想以一种可爱的方式传达“真累，我什么都不想做，我感到懒惰，我困了”这样的感觉。我觉得扎实的摇滚乐队的声音不适合歌词，所以当我在 TikTok 上听到 Botchiboromaru 的《Otose Thunder》时，我认为轻快、清新的风格非常适合，所以我请他们为我写。

“Antares”有九位客座歌手。阵容不仅限于hololive的同事，还包括来自其他机构的VTuber和主播。

我是 Hololive 中的异类，因为我有很多机会与其他组织的人员合作。我的管理层对此给予了支持，我认为这是我的卖点之一，所以我也想在这张专辑上进行合作，这就是为什么我接触了来自其他公司的各种人和其他 Hololive VTuber。 《Antares》是在考虑到合作的情况下编写的。我想一起唱歌。我觉得如果能在现场表演时和观众一起唱这首歌就好了。

您认为这些合作与您所说的最初成为 VTuber 的动机是想交朋友有关吗？

是的。作为一个VTuber和主播，我想尽可能地融入好的影响力，而在这之前，我想做一些有趣的事情。正如我经常告诉我的粉丝的那样，我不想做出于义务的事情。我想传达我是如何享受乐趣的，并让人们在观看我这样做时获得乐趣。所以在我看来，我的合作者所属的公司并不重要，只要我们一起做的事情是愉快的。

与VSPO所属的猫田纲合作！ （虚拟电子竞技项目），专辑中最后一首歌曲“Nininsankyaku”。这个是怎么来的呢？

唱歌和玩第一人称射击游戏是常暗东和的两大支柱。我经常参加FPS游戏比赛，当我和Tsuna组队时，我们一起哭一起笑，加深了我们的友谊。我们一起分享美好的回忆，她现在是我最好的朋友之一。这就是为什么我想和纲要唱一首歌，并向管理层询问如何实现这一点。我想我们的粉丝可能知道我们的关系，所以我希望有一天我们可以一起在舞台上表演。最近我每天至少听一次这首歌。每当我在做某事时听到它时，它都会让我感动。 [笑]

Tsuna 在这首歌的创作过程中有发言权吗？

在这首歌投入制作之前，纲和我写下了这些冗长的备忘录，讲述我们对彼此的看法。即使是一些俗气的话，比如“多亏了你，我现在变得更坚强了。” [笑]我们准备了这些信件，我想你可以称呼它们，并将它们发送给歌曲作者，然后由他们将它们反映在我们的歌词中。我认为这首歌确实抓住了这种精神。有一段我们轮流唱歌的部分，一边互相表达自己的感受，一边录制，度过了一段愉快的时光。

你的第一场个人演唱会“Break your xxx”将于 10 月 13 日星期五举行。演出会是什么样的？

我将与现场乐队一起表演，所以这将是一场狂野、有趣的表演。我现在正在努力准备，因为我想确保我的声音不会被乐队的声音所掩盖，并且我的感情能够传达给每个人，无论是来的人还是参加直播的人会想：“那太棒了。”

节目名称背后的含义是什么？

在我的职业生涯中，有时我会感到焦虑和沮丧，但感谢我的粉丝和管理层，我现在能够进行这样的现场表演。 《Break your xxx》的意思是我想克服阴郁的情绪，获得自信，战胜自己。我确信每个人都会经历痛苦和困难的时刻，但我想邀请人们在我的音乐会上一起打破这些事情。 “xxx”中的内容取决于您。每个人都在共同打造这场音乐会。

告诉我们您对首张专辑和首次现场表演之外的未来的愿景。

当然，我很想举办第二场音乐会，而且我很想站在日本以外的舞台上。在我举步维艰的时候，其他国家的粉丝也非常支持我，所以我想去向他们表达我的谢意。

2023 年 NBA 总决赛：以下是免费观看迈阿密热火队对阵丹佛掘金队比赛的方法

; Drake 的“For All the Dogs”专辑中您最喜欢的歌曲是什么？投票！ https://www.billboard.com/music/rb-hip-hop/drake-for-all-the-dogs-best-song-poll-1235437123/ Tue, 10 Oct 2023 19:59:02 +0000 MusicR&B/Hip-HopMusic NewsR&B/Hip-Hop https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235437123 We want to know which track from the new album you think is best.

Drake的最新专辑《 For All the Dogs》终于来了。该专辑于周五（10 月 6 日）发行，这位说唱歌手携几位特邀嘉宾回归，包括 SZA、21 Savage、J. Cole、Chief Keef、Sexyy Red、Snoop Dogg 等。

在《For All the Dogs》发行之前，Drake 发行了 SZA 协助的单曲“Slime You Out”。这首歌因其是两人的首次合作以及他们浪漫的过去而迅速受到关注。这首歌还在Billboard排行榜上引起了轰动，发行后在Billboard Hot 100排行榜上名列第一。

有关的

Drake 的《For All the Dogs》：全部 23 首歌曲排名

10/10/2023

听众们在社交媒体上对“恐高症”也有足够多的讨论，因为有些人认为它是对前恋人蕾哈娜和她现任男友 A$AP Rocky 的侮辱。在歌曲的前奏中，说唱歌手多次重复“Anti”这个词，这也是蕾哈娜2016年专辑的标题。德雷克随后表示，人们“听起来好像[他]仍然挂断电话”，并且似乎在嘲笑洛基，说，“那个男人，他仍然和你在一起，他不能离开你/你们都去度假，我打赌那是安的列斯群岛。”这位“工作”歌手的祖国和经常度假的地方巴巴多斯位于加勒比海的小安的列斯群岛地区。粉丝们还猜测他在《弗吉尼亚海滩》和《另一个深夜》中挖苦了蕾哈娜和 A$AP。

专辑中的其他曲目包括备受期待的 Bad Bunny 合作曲目（“Gently”）、与 sexyy 和 SZA 的双人合作（“Rich Baby Daddy”）、Chief Keef 样本（“7969 Santa”）等等。

虽然歌迷们还需要等待，看看下周这套专辑及其各自的 23 首歌曲会登上Billboard 200和 Hot 100 排行榜的哪个位置，但《For All the Dogs》中的哪首歌是你最喜欢的呢？在下面的民意调查中投票。

; 2023 年拉丁音乐周摄影棚：Maria Becerra、Sebastián Yatra、Carin León 等https://www.billboard.com/photos/2023-latin-music-week-photobooth-sebastian-yatra-1235433007/Michael Calcagno Tue, 10 Oct 2023 19:53:00 +0000 LatinMusicBillboardlatin music weekmiamiPhoto Galleryphotobooth https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=pmc-gallery&p=1235433007 See some of the photobooth gems captured backstage throughout the week. 

Sebastián Yatra 、Chencho Corleone、Vico C、 RBD 、Carin León、Maria Becerra、Young Miko 和Eladio Carrión等 50 多位拉丁音乐明星在迈阿密 2023 年公告牌拉丁音乐周（10 月 2 日）上登上舞台中心-6）。

作为为期一周的活动的一部分，一些拉丁音乐界的大腕们前往迈阿密海滩进行独家对话、表演、小组讨论，并在摄影棚前摆姿势——摄影师玛丽·贝丝·科思在镜头后面。

从深入的艺术家对话到有关目录、财务、流媒体和出版的商业讨论，拉丁音乐周还包括与行业领袖、巡演发起人以及两版摇滚明星秀、雷鬼明星Nicky Jam的脱口秀的深入小组讨论，其中包括采访Ivy Queen和Fuerza Regida的主唱 Jesús Ortiz Paz。

Billboard 拉丁音乐首席内容官Leila Cobo表示：“拉丁音乐周在过去十年中稳步发​​展，反映了 Billboard 对拉丁音乐的承诺，以及拉丁音乐对Billboard作为拉丁音乐趋势和成功的主要仲裁者的坚定支持。”和西班牙语。

这项为期多天的活动被认为是拉丁音乐行业以及顶级和新兴艺术家的重要目的地，吸引了超过 1,200 名粉丝和业内人士参加为期三天的小组讨论、演讲以及在迈阿密海滩 Faena 论坛上进行的一生一次的亲密对话。代表了当今全球拉丁音乐的众多既定和新兴流派。

欣赏整个拉丁音乐周后台拍摄的一些最佳照相馆瑰宝。

; “这是一个死亡陷阱”：以色列狂欢大屠杀幸存者详细描述了他们的逃脱，但仍然失踪https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/israel-festival-massacre-survivors-detail-escape-many-missing-1235438576/ Tue, 10 Oct 2023 19:31:56 +0000 MusicMusic NewsbbnewsfestivalsInternationalIsraelNews https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235438576 Vivid accounts of the Hamas terrorist attack on the Supernova Sukkot Gathering begin to emerge. "These were just kids going to a party.”

随着巴勒斯坦组织哈马斯继续袭击以色列，而该国也通过轰炸加沙进行报复，加沙边境附近的帕拉莱洛宇宙超新星住棚节电子音乐节恐怖袭击的幸存者正在继续对数百人进行严峻的搜救。仍然失踪。

截至目前，以色列搜救组织扎卡报告称，在以色列雷伊姆的节日现场发现了260具尸体。数量不详的与会者被哈马斯恐怖分子绑架。 据《纽约时报》报道，周六（10 月 7 日）至少有 150 名以色列人被绑架，其中一些人是在狂欢派对上被带走的。

周二上午（10 月 10 日），拜登总统在谈到以色列与哈马斯冲突时提到了这场大屠杀，他将“年轻人在参加庆祝和平的音乐节时遭到屠杀”列为过去几天的暴力事件之一。

据出席活动并代表演出阵容中多位艺人的艺人经理拉兹·加斯特(Raz Gaster)称，截至周日晚上，据信有 600-700 名音乐节观众在袭击发生后失踪。仍然失踪的确切人数尚未得到核实，但以色列的两个消息来源称这一数字约为 150 人，其中包括已找到并确认身份的尸体以及已确认身份的幸存者；不过，当地的另一位消息人士表示，目前还很难确定还有多少人失踪。

有关的

艺术家经理描述以色列狂欢大屠杀：“它变成了一场噩梦”

10/10/2023

加斯特是一位参加了此次活动并代表阵容中多个艺人的艺人经理，他周二（10 月 10 日）告诉Billboard ，他和音乐节制作团队的成员正在努力寻找幸存者，并收集有关仍然失踪的音乐节参加者的信息。

“归根结底，我们作为人类有责任向这些失踪人员的家人提供我们能得到的任何信息，”加斯特说。 “我们将继续努力，直到获得有关他们每一个人的信息。”

超新星住棚节 (Supernova Sukkot Gathering) 是巴西历史悠久的节日品牌 Paralelllo Universo 的以色列分支，其名称是为了纪念犹太住棚节节日，在设有两个舞台的乡村场地接待了约 3,000 名与会者。

那些逃离节日的人描述了周六早上 6 点 30 分左右，火箭弹从加沙飞来，其中一些落在雷伊姆附近时所发生的恐怖景象。 20分钟内，携带枪支和火箭弹的恐怖分子乘坐全地形车、皮卡车、摩托车以及滑翔伞抵达，并立即开始向与会者开枪。

Shelly Barel 在以色列各地的音乐节上销售珠宝和服装，自 10 月 5 日星期四以来一直在该网站。当时，户外空间正在举办另一个 psytrance 节日 Unity，Supernova Sukkot Gathering 将于周五开始。两天前，在以色列南部的另一个地点塌陷后，超新星住棚节才被转移到雷伊姆地点。

“这个节日太有趣了，”巴雷尔通过翻译谈到超新星住棚节时说道。 “了不起的人们，真的充满了欢乐。”

当周六清晨火箭开始坠落时，一切都改变了。巴雷尔和她的丈夫倒在地上并躺了至少五分钟，直到节日保安发布公告，告诉参加者跑到自己的车上并离开现场。巴雷尔和她的丈夫花了 10 分钟收拾行李，然后将它们装进车里开车离开，巴雷尔的丈夫坐在方向盘上。当时，他们认为自己被要求撤离是因为火箭袭击，这在以色列相对经常发生。

有关的

布鲁诺·马尔斯奉命在恐怖袭击中撤离以色列，留下他的乐队……

10/10/2023

他们很快就遇到了试图退出节日的汽车的瓶颈。在没有意识到武装袭击者已经到来的情况下，他们右转并驶过现场附近的泥土地，而不是在出口处等候。这个决定，既出于不耐烦和逃跑的本能，也可能挽救了他们的生命。

“事后看来，”巴雷尔说，“我明白恐怖分子射杀了第一辆汽车中的人，所以这些汽车无法移动，其余的汽车都被困在后面。他们为随后而来的每个人造成了交通堵塞。这是一个死亡陷阱。”

当巴雷尔和她的丈夫开车离开田地回到路上时，他们遇到了两辆停着的车辆，两辆车的车门都开着。然后他们看到那些车辆的乘客倒在地上死了。

巴雷尔的丈夫掉头，几分钟后收到了他的陆军预备队某人的短信，称该地区有袭击者。 “当我们意识到我们必须害怕恐怖分子时，”巴雷尔说，“导弹似乎是最小的问题。”

他继续开车，按照指示牌前往最近的城市。 “我们决定尽可能快地行驶，加足油门，只在转弯时减速，”她说。 “火箭在我们周围落下，此时我想是时候互相说‘我爱你’并说再见了。”

他们没有被击中。最终，他们回到了以色列中部的家。在那里，他们发现节日的一些朋友被杀，而其他人则被绑架了。许多人仍然失踪。

来自特拉维夫的 26 岁安全专家尼泰也参加了 Supernova Sukkot 音乐节，他说，当枪手出现并开始向节日观众开枪时，他正在帮助一位艺术家收拾一些装备。枪声响起后，“当我逃离袭击时，我的朋友打电话给我，让我设法找到他的妹妹，”不愿透露姓氏的尼泰说。 “我真的很想帮助他，但我不得不逃跑并躲藏起来。我感觉自己一直被枪声包围。”

尼泰跑了几英里，最终在橄榄树林里躲了 10 个小时。有一次，他以为自己避难的那群人被说阿拉伯语的武装人员发现了——他们距离大约 20 码，近到他可以透过橄榄树枝看到这些人的腿。

“我向几年前去世的父亲祈祷，请求他帮助我，”尼泰回忆道。当他躲藏起来时，这些人开始大喊大叫，尼泰说他已经做好了迎接袭击的准备。喊叫声持续了大约半小时，然后武装人员开始从他和其他几人（其中包括两名来自阿根廷的游客）躲藏的地区撤退。他们在那里又呆了几个小时，直到以色列终于到达并将他们带到附近的警察局。尼泰说他从未找到他朋友的妹妹。

自从巴雷尔和她的丈夫逃脱以来，他们也一直在寻找有关失踪朋友的信息，但尽管讣告已经开始出现，但他们并没有找到太多信息。她说，当她公寓楼的电梯门打开，里面有一个她不认识的男人时，她的创伤记忆犹新，以至于她变得“歇斯底里”。

几十年来，以色列的舞曲音乐界一直蓬勃发展。 Psytrance, the electronic subgenre featured on the Supernova Sukkot lineup, became big in Israel in the late '80s and '90s, and it has been the country's biggest electronic sound since, although house and techno have also grown in popularity in recent years.

On any given weekend, especially between March and October, there are several big parties like Supernova Sukkot throughout Israel, with crowd sizes ranging between 50 and 10,000, according to Amotz Tokatly , who's been involved in the country's electronic scene for more than 20 years as a promoter, manager, consultant and writer. “If you go to a psytrance party or a house or techno club, you see people from the age of 18 to 60 or even 70,” says Tokatly. “It's a basic activity in Israel. We love to dance. We love to go out.”

It's hard to tell what will happen to this scene in the aftermath of the attack, not to mention the war that is expected to follow.

“What happened here is a disaster. It's unbearable,” says Tokatly. “The most important thing for us is to [show] the world that this is a crime against innocent people. They don't belong to any political side. These were just kids going to a party.”

Additional reporting by Tal Rimon .

; Toby Keith Tops Country Digital Song Sales Chart With 'Don't Let the Old Man In' https://www.billboard.com/pro/toby-keith-dont-let-the-old-man-in-number-1-country-digital-song-sales-chart/ Tue, 10 Oct 2023 19:30:40 +0000 Chart BeatMusicMusic News https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235438768 Plus, Jelly Roll and Lainey Wilson's "Save Me" hits the Hot Country Songs top 10.

Toby Keith 's 2018 track “Don't Let the Old Man In” flies from No. 11 to No. 1 on Billboard ’s Country Digital Song Sales chart (dated Oct. 14). In the Sept. 29-Oct. 5 tracking week, it sold 13,000 downloads in the United States, up 482%, according to Luminate.

Keith performed the ballad, which was initially released in 2018, on the inaugural People's Choice Country Awards (Sept. 28 on NBC) after receiving the country icon trophy. He boasts 20 No. 1s on the Hot Country Songs chart, among 42 top 10s, dating to his 1993 debut.

有关的

Toby Keith Offers Health Update at People's Choice Country Awards After Cancer Diagnosis: 'You Just…

10/10/2023

The song, which Keith solely authored, becomes his second No. 1, among six top 10s, on Country Digital Song Sales. “Red Solo Cup” dominated for 14 frames starting in November 2011.

On the all-genre Digital Song Sales survey, the track jumps 19-3, giving Keith his highest rank, among three top 10s. “Happy Birthday America” hit No. 5 in 2021 and “Red Solo Cup” reached No. 8 in 2011.

Keith, 62, has been fighting stomach cancer since 2021, a diagnosis that he revealed publicly in June 2022.

The singer-songwriter told Billboard in 2018 that “Don't Let the Old Man In” was inspired by Clint Eastwood, director and star of The Mule , the movie in which the song premiered. Struck by Eastwood's relentless energy when the film legend was then 88 years young, Keith asked how he kept going. “He said, 'I just get up every morning and go out. And I don't let the old man in,' ” Keith recounted. “And I thought, I'm writing that.”

'Save Me' Rolls to Top 10

Jelly Roll's “Save Me” with Lainey Wilson reaches the Hot Country Songs top 10, climbing 13-10.

The collaboration gives Jelly Roll his third top 10 and Wilson her sixth (in as many chart visits). It surged by 30% to 12.2 million audience impressions in the tracking week and pushes 18-16 for a new best on Country Airplay. It also drew 8.6 million official streams and sold 4,000.

Jelly Roll co-penned “Save Me” with David Ray. It follows his “Need a Favor,” which hit No. 3 on Hot Country Songs in July. The latter also led Country Airplay for four weeks beginning in August, becoming his second leader, following “Son of a Sinner,” his first entry which reigned for a week in January.

Wilson adds her sixth Hot Country Songs top 10. “Save Me” follows “Watermelon Moonshine,” which rises 10-7 for a new high. It leads Country Airplay for a second week, up 12% to 30.4 million impressions, having become her third leader a week earlier.

; Chris Young Taps David Bowie's 'Rebel' Spirit For 'Young Love & Saturday Nights' https://www.billboard.com/music/country/chris-young-young-love-saturday-nights-makin-tracks-1235438825/ Tue, 10 Oct 2023 19:29:00 +0000 CountryMusicMakin TracksMusic News https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235438825 The country star's latest release is featured in this week's Makin' Tracks.

It shouldn't work: David Bowie's “Rebel Rebel,” with its androgynous storyline and garage-band sound, is from the height of the British glam-rock era, when sexual freedom and defying authority were key tenets in youth culture. Chris Young, a mainstream Southern guy whose persona is not built on rebellion, interpolated the song in his own “Young Love & Saturday Nights” — and somehow, Bowie's edgy rock riff works within the centrist country sound.

“Young Love & Saturday Nights” arrives nearly 50 years after “Rebel Rebel” was introduced on Bowie's 1974 album Diamond Dogs , and at nearly every concert, Young sees fans perk up when they hear Bowie's familiar lick, the same way that his senses were twisted when a publisher played it for him without warning during a song meeting. “I didn't have any idea,” Young says, “and within like the first six seconds, I'm like, 'That's David Bowie. Why are you playing a David Bowie song?'”

By the time it was over, Young was obsessed. It would, he knew, provide a guitar lick for his concerts that felt like he was doing a cover song for anyone who knew “Rebel Rebel.” But it was still different enough from the original to stand on its own for anyone who didn't identify its origin.

“Most people get the feeling when that song starts — they go, 'Why is this familiar?'” says Young, interpreting the facial responses he has witnessed at his shows. “Then the minute that [signature riff arrives], you know immediately what it is, and then it smacks you right in the face at the top of the verse with, 'No, this is something new.'”

Turning familiar music into something new was the general idea when songwriter Jesse Frasure (“She Had Me at Heads Carolina,” “If I Was a Cowboy”) started sifting through the Bowie catalog for titles that could be ripe for a country re-imagining. The idea might sound like rock'n'roll heresy, but Bowie's estate practically commissioned the work, conveying interest to Warner Chappell in seeing his music reinterpreted for country. Frasure drew the assignment, and initially had “Heroes” in his crosshairs, before shifting to “Rebel Rebel.”

“One thing was for sure: I didn't want a David Bowie interpolation to end up hokey,” Frasure recalls. “I felt like 'Heroes' could be a little bit sappy and hokey if we did it in a country setting, so I felt like this one at least would have a little bit more edge to it and may be just a little cooler.”

The iconic riff was, of course, the main attraction, in part because Bowie never sang that line as a melody. That meant that a can't-miss hook was available for the chorus, and Frasure fashioned a basic track to work from, then sent it off to two collaborators, Ashley Gorley (“Last Night,” “Truck Bed”) and Josh Thompson (“Stars Like Confetti,” “I'll Name the Dogs”), for a Zoom writing session. While they kept the riff, they dropped the “Rebel Rebel” lyrical theme, in which Bowie calls his mysteriously gendered date a “hot tramp.”

“We just tried to find something country to kind of balance it out,” Gorley says. “I have no idea who came up with the title. I think we were just kind of spitballing stuff and thinking of different ideas, and then that kind of spit out there at the end somewhere.”

They purposely avoided using the word “rebel” in the text, though they were determined to find a blue-collar version. Frasure referenced the guy working the docks in Bon Jovi's “Livin' On a Prayer” as the template. They settled on a local club musician with a rundown Chevy Silverado and a star-struck girlfriend whose father disapproves of her bad-boy choice.

“That scenario is pretty timeless,” says Gorley. “It can happen tonight, and 40 years ago, you know — 50 years ago, whatever that was — the same kind of things were going on. They're still playing in their bands, driving things that barely run, falling in love with somebody. It's still happening.”

Even before they knew what the song would be, Frasure had envisioned the word “Alabama” fitting in the middle of the chorus, and that translated into the couple listening to “'89 Alabama.” And in the second verse, they kept the cultural references going by name-checking Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash and James Dean.

“I've always been fascinated by the fact that history repeats itself,” Frasure says. “To me, it's so cliché: You pick up guitars, you get the girls, and it's been repeating itself. And probably the last person you want your daughter to date, that's the one that they're going crazy for. So to me, that was a tribute to all those things that we love — you know, drugs, sex and rock'n'roll — and package it in a country-friendly way.”

Once they finished the Zoom write, Frasure completed work on a programmed demo, then had Thompson record a vocal. They pitched it around town a bit with no takers, until Young flipped over it, and texted the writers often enough that they knew he would follow through and record it.

Young invited Frasure and Gorley to attend the tracking session with co-producer Corey Crowder (Chase Rice, Florida Georgia Line) in November 2022 at the Sony Tree Studios, a demo facility that had been recently upgraded. Crowder wanted the master to have a live sort of energy, matching both the raw tone of Bowie's “Rebel Rebel” and the bar-band plot of “Young Love & Saturday Nights,” and Sony Tree was an ideal setting.

“It's a cool room,” says Crowder. “I think it actually helped that specific song, just because they're all in the room together like they're up onstage or something.”

Drummer Chris McHugh re-created the power of the original “Rebel Rebel” backbeat, and Crowder spent extra time with guitarist Sol Philcox-Littlefield, emulating the sound of the Bowie riff.

“We hunted on that for a minute,” Crowder remembers. “There was several takes where we had to like, 'Let's get it a little thinner,' that kind of thing. That tone was so perfect, you know, you just don't want to ditch that. So that was a big priority for me.”

Young did the lead vocals later with co-producer Chris DeStefano (Chase Rice, Morgan Evans), making certain to get plenty of sleep the night prior. “Living up to the fact that you're constantly going to be compared with someone who's a legend, I definitely did not leave that vocal booth until I was done,” says Young.

“Young Love & Saturday Nights” got significant media attention when Bowie's country interpolation debuted on streaming services on July 21. RCA Nashville released it to country radio on Sept. 11 via PlayMPE, and it entered Country Airplay quickly, rising to No. 49 on the chart dated Oct. 14.

“I've now probably said the word 'interpolation' more than I ever have in my entire life in the past two months talking about this, but it's really exciting for me because I love the song,” Young says. “And it's cool to see other people getting pumped about it.”

; How Does *NSYNC's No. 25 Debut Compare to Our Expectations for Their First Single in Two Decades? https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/nsync-better-place-hot-100-debut-five-burning-questions-1235438814/ Tue, 10 Oct 2023 19:27:59 +0000 Chart BeatMusicfive burning questions https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235438814 In this week's Five Burning Questions, the man band's new single for the Trolls Band Together soundtrack scores a respectable bow, if not an overwhelming one.;

This week, pop fans get to see a once-familiar group of faces on the Billboard Hot 100 for the first time in over 20 years: *NSYNC , the chart-topping superstar boy band who were once in the discussion for the biggest act in popular music, have returned with their new single “Better Place.”

The new single, found on the soundtrack to the upcoming boy band-themed animated sequel Trolls Band Together , bows at No. 25 on the chart this week, with excellent sales and early radio numbers. It's the group's first Hot 100 appearance since the Nelly-featuring “Girlfriend” reached No. 5 in 2002.

How should the group be feeling about the song's entrance? And where will the group likely go from here? Billboard staffers discuss these questions and more below.

1. *NSYNC's first single in over 20 years, “Better Place,” debuts at No. 25 on the Hot 100 this week. Is that higher, lower or about what you expected for its first week?

Katie Atkinson: Judging by the fervor over the reunion at last month's MTV VMAs, it's lower than I expected. I think it could have reasonably had a top 10 or at least top 20 debut had they released it the same week as the VMAs. Instead of the momentum building in the weeks after, it seemed to fizzle a bit, with high-hoped fans realizing that a Trolls song might be the only thing they're getting from the reunited boy band – no new music outside the movie, and seemingly no tour or concert.

I kept telling my hopeful friends that if the song had a high debut, Justin Timberlake (who seems to be the holdout, since he was the one missing from Ariana Grande's Coachella performance in 2019) would have to at least consider something beyond the Trolls music. But I don't know that a No. 25 debut is going to motivate him to do anything further with his bandmates.

Kyle Denis : This is around what I expected, maybe a bit higher than what I was initially predicting. I think a No. 25 debut perfectly encapsulates the tension between the hype for the return of one of the biggest musical acts in pop history and the radically different commercial landscape they're returning to.

Jason Lipshutz : About what I expected, in context with how the Trolls singles that preceded “Better Place” over the course of the franchise performed: Justin Timberlake's “Can't Stop the Feeling!” made it to No. 1 on the Hot 100, Timberlake and SZA's “The Other Side” reached No. 61, and “Better Place” more or less splits the difference. *NSYNC is still a brand name, and their first single in over 20 years was always going to generate interest — so a top 40 debut seemed likely, even as they've got a lot of catching up to do in terms of modern streaming fans.

Andrew Unterberger : It's actually a lot better than I expected based on the early crickets around the song online, and the fact that *NSYNC has been gone so long that a new Justin Timberlake solo song — even one alongside, say, two of his old collaborators — can't really move the needle anymore. “Better Place” owes its impressive debut to a combination of massive radio support, sales from fans who haven't completely moved on from the iTunes era and a relatively slow week on the chart, without a big new album release to clutter the top tiers.

Christine Werthman : No. 25 is lower than I expected, considering the hoopla around the group's VMA appearance, but it's pretty on point for Timberlake's Trolls tunes. While “Can't Stop the Feeling!” debuted at No. 1 in 2016, “The Other Side” with SZA started at No. 61 in 2020 and never went any higher. So, I suppose it makes sense that this one dropped roughly in the middle. I just thought that getting the gang back together would snag it a slightly higher debut.

2. “Better Place” is off to an excellent start at radio and in sales, but its streams have been fairly minimal. Does it seem like a lasting pop hit to you, or is No. 25 likely as good as it will get for the Trolls sequel single?

Katie Atkinson: I think it could definitely climb higher if the group releases a proper music video – meaning, the actual *NSYNC performing choreography, not animated clips of the Trolls boy band. Of course, with the ongoing actors' strike, that's a big ask. Timberlake isn't going to want to look like he's not supporting his fellow actors, even though he is likely clear to promote the film in his capacity as a featured musician and not as the voice star. But if actors are able to follow in the footsteps of the Hollywood writers' strike, which wrapped more than a week ago, there's a world where we could get a classic *NSYNC music video (can MTV revive TRL for a day?) and the song gets new life.

Kyle Denis : As it happens with soundtrack singles – a lot of this song's future success depends on how big/well-received the Trolls sequel is, how much money and effort are put into its promotion, and how the song is incorporated into the movie. There's certainly potential for this to stick around the No. 20-40 range – and potentially sneak a weak or two in the lower reaches of the top 10 – thanks to radio's support. To grow into a legitimate, lasting smash, however, “Better Place” will have to pick up on streaming, but that'll be hard to do with a musical act that's been absent for the entirety of the streaming era.

Jason Lipshutz : It's hard to say since, while I don't think “Better Place” will become a huge streaming hit, I could envision radio programmers gravitating towards a new *NSYNC single, considering how many of them undoubtedly remember the group's turn-of-the-century enormity and would love to incorporate their new song's sunny pop sound into power blocks. “Better Place” may not rise above No. 25 on the Hot 100, yet the song will likely enjoy a comfortable run on FM dials — especially around the release of the new Trolls movie, when parents and kids are going to be happy to hear how it ties into the story of the film.

Andrew Unterberger : I'm… not optimistic about it sticking around. That said, it was just last year that another whistle-heavy song by an '00s pop group rode a sequel soundtrack placement to extended chart success, so maybe *NSYNC will be able to follow the formula there. (It would help if Trolls Band Together was at least 1/20th as successful as Top Gun: Maverick , of course.)

Christine Werthman : The movie comes out in November, so by the time we get to the Thanksgiving car rides with the kiddos, it might be in more frequent streaming rotation. It's also got that breezy, dentist's-office-appropriate energy that will give it staying power, so I think it's got a little more gas in the tank and won't stall at 25. Maybe 20?

3. What would you be looking for regarding the song's performance if you were on *NSYNC's team? What, if anything, do you think they stand to gain with a good reception to the new single?

Katie Atkinson: I would be looking at the window from now through the film's release on Nov. 17 to see if it grows from here, whether that's through a music video, radio airplay or some sort of belated social virality. If this song peaks at No. 25, I think fans holding out hope for anything else from *NSYNC will be gravely disappointed. But if it has legs, who knows what could happen? I refuse to believe that we're just going to get a cartoon song and a Hot Ones episode out of this whole thing.

Kyle Denis : If I were on *NSYNC's team, I'd be paying attention to the song's longevity above all else. We all know that the first new song from *NSYCNC in over two decades would get an incredibly warm reception across consumption channels upon debut. Now, if “Better Place” can harness that early love and turn it into weeks of stability and substantial growth, that, to me, would be a signal that there's a place in the contemporary marketplace for *NSYNC outside of nostalgia bait.

Jason Lipshutz : This is a little bit of wishcasting, but if “Better Place” hypothetically turns into an all-out smash, that might somewhat compel *NSYNC to hitting the road together, right? Thus far, there has been no indication that their new single precedes the quintet's first tour in over two decades, but if anything is going to potentially tip the scales a bit, it would be “Better Place” growing bigger than expected, and bridging the gap to a new generation of *NSYNC fans. Maybe a tour isn't in the cards regardless of the song's performance, but here's hoping, right?

Andrew Unterberger : Honestly, I wouldn't even be trying to get on radio or even on TikTok in 2023 if I was *NSYNC's team — I'd just be hitting those pleasure centers for the longtime fans, the ones actually likely to buy tickets for an upcoming tour if and when one happens. There's no particularly likely path back to contemporary stardom for *NSYNC in an era when, again, even JT solo can't seem to find his way back in. They'd be much better off not even trying, especially since the Backstreet Boys have proven that '90s boy bands can still have a very lucrative second life as a legacy act.

Christine Werthman : I'd be crossing my fingers for some TikTok pickup, hoping that Gen Z cared as much as Millennials about this boy band reunion. *NSYNC isn't going to skyrocket back to No Strings Attached levels of popularity, but if there's some interest here, it could prompt some more new music, maybe a couple reunion shows.

4. With *NSYNC now (at least temporarily) reunited, who's another pop group that's been dormant for at least a decade who you'd like to see give it another go?

Katie Atkinson: Destiny's Child – whether it's the trio lineup of Beyoncé, Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams, or even adding LaTavia Roberson and LeToya Luckett into the mix, since all four of those women attended Queen B's hometown Renaissance Tour stop in Houston last month. After all, fans already think DC could be involved in “act ii” of Bey's Renaissance album series . Honestly, a Destiny's Child reunion seems way more realistic than anything beyond “Better Place” for *NSYNC at this point.

Kyle Denis : Salt-N-Pepa.

Jason Lipshutz : All five Spice Girls haven't performed together since 2012 — and that was only a few songs for the London Olympics, not a full-fledged tour. Not only do I think a Spice Girls reunion trek would be entertaining as hell, but I'd love to hear their blended perspectives on a new single, EP or album; they accomplished so much in the '90s, have grown into different people in the years since, and I'd bet whatever they cooked up in the studio would be, at the very least, thematically interesting.

Andrew Unterberger : Anyone else out there who would have major interest in a Junior Senior hyperpop album? Just me perhaps?

Christine Werthman : Savage Garden. Darren Hayes still releases solo music, his latest album, Homosexual , dropping in 2022, but Daniel Jones called it quits and meant it. He hated touring, works in real estate and, like Hayes, says they will never reunite. I honestly salute their commitment to the breakup, but that would be a fun one.

5. OK, it's been seven years since Timberlake's “Can't Stop the Feeling!,” from the original Trolls , topped the Hot 100 — how do you feel about the song in 2023?

Katie Atkinson: I have much fonder feelings toward that song now than I did when it was first released. At the time, I wrestled with how uncool it was – but it's a carefree, fun song from a kids' movie. Of course it's uncool! After dancing to it on countless wedding dance floors in the seven years since, I've come to peace with the fact that it's a harmless, happy song whose charms are hard to resist.

Kyle Denis : It's not a song that I would defend with my life, but I've never really understood the distaste for this one. It's fun and full of my favorite pop song clichés, so I can't be too mad at it. Doesn't add much to JT's discography, but that wasn't the goal, so I'll continue to enjoy it for what it is.

Jason Lipshutz : Pretty much the same as I felt about it seven years ago: not my favorite JT song, but it's undeniably catchy, and I really love the sing-along outro. Really, we should be using this space to cry Justice For “The Other Side,” the Trolls World Tour single that demonstrated some nu-disco chemistry between Timberlake and SZA. Should have been bigger!

Andrew Unterberger : Never really need to hear it outside a wedding context, but would be lying if I said I did not get that feeling in my body when it comes on.

Christine Werthman : It didn't make my personal top songs list in 2016 (lots of Beyoncé, Solange, Rihanna, Drake and Frank Ocean though — what a year!), but it's a cute track. Was then, is now. I'm sure at the time I was outraged that No. 1 wasn't something from The Life of Pablo , but you can't sleep on those family-friendly hits.

; Red Rocks Generates More Than $700M Annually for Denver & Colorado, Study Finds https://www.billboard.com/pro/red-rocks-amphitheater-economic-impact-700m-denver-colorado/ Tue, 10 Oct 2023 19:20:09 +0000 BusinessTouringDenvereconomyRed Rocksvenues https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235438889 According to an economic impact report, the 83-year-old venue was responsible for 7,300 full- and part-time jobs last year.

The Red Rocks Amphitheater in Morrison, Colorado has long been a must-play venue for touring artists and a top destination for music fans thanks to its natural beauty and geologically driven acoustics. Now, a recent economic impact report commissioned by Denver Arts and Venues [DAV], which owns and operates Red Rocks on behalf of the city of Denver, quantifies the financial power of the red sandstone venue first opened in 1941, estimating that the 9,525-capacity amphitheater is responsible for generating $717 million annually in the Denver metro area and the state of Colorado.

The first-ever economic impact study of Red Rocks Amphitheatre's role in local economies, by BBC Research & Consulting (BBC), evaluated data from the 2022 Red Rocks concert season in hopes of quantifying the ripple effects of dollars spent in the region by fans, tourists and crews who bring shows to the 83-year-old venue's iconic stage.

有关的

How Red Rocks Amphitheater Raised $234K for Charity in 2022 By Tapping Into Artists…

10/10/2023

“Red Rocks is the most amazing concert venue in the world,” said Denver Mayor Mike Johnston in a statement. “This study proves what Denverites have known for years: Red Rocks, and Denver's creative community, are powerful economic and cultural forces for our city.”

The report found that Red Rocks was responsible for 7,300 full- and part-time jobs last year, generating $216 million in payroll in the Denver metro area and an additional $6 million statewide. Last year, Red Rocks clocked in $186 million in ticket sales from an attendance of 1,747,465 at 217 ticketed events — an increase of nearly 300% from 75 events just a decade ago.

“From performers and stagehands to box office staff and maintenance crews, 1.5 million Red Rocks fans means a big boost for the local concert industry,” said Tad Bowman , venue manager at Red Rocks. “There will be 400 people working on-site each show, but there are literally thousands of jobs across the region supported by what happens at Red Rocks.”

The report found that 30 percent of fans, on an average night, travel to Red Rocks from from outside the Denver Metro Area, with the top visitor markets being Chicago, New York/New Jersey, Los Angeles, Dallas-Ft. Worth, Minneapolis-St. Paul and San Francisco.

Last year, Red Rocks recorded almost $40 million in gross concessions revenue and is the top on-premise location in the United States for sales of White Claw Hard. Overall, the venue sells more than 1 million malted beverages annually, including more than 400,000 seltzers.

“Every Coke or Coors sold has a long line of people who've gotten that beverage into a fan's hands,” said Brian Kitts , who oversees Red Rocks' corporate partnerships and marketing.

For its part, the city-owned venue spends $8.5 million on annual maintenance and notes that money spent at Red Rocks supports government and city arts and cultural programs, including $6 million in tax revenue to the city of Denver as well as money spent to enhance venue security and fan experience.

“The study makes it clear that regular re-investment back into the venues managed by DAV are crucial in ensuring Red Rocks is and continues to be a destination for visitors and an important piece of Colorado's economic puzzle for years to come,” added Bowman.

More information, including the full study, can be found at RedRocksOnline.com/Impact .
